thread.title: A Close-Up Look at the Armani Privé Gown You May See on the Oscars Red Carpet
thread.title_full: A Close-Up Look at the Armani Privé Gown You May See on the Oscars Red Carpet

author: Emily Farra
title: A Close-Up Look at the Armani Privé Gown You May See on the Oscars Red Carpet
text:
A Close-Up Look at the Armani Privé Gown You May See on the Oscars Red Carpet January 25, 2017 5:31 pm Expand Photo: Indigital.tv 
Just when you thought you sort of knew what to expect from Armani Privé —strong suiting, frothy gowns, a fair amount of shine— Giorgio Armani throws you for a loop with a heavily orange collection . “Is orange ever going to be the new black, or will black always be safer?” Vogue.com’s Sarah Mower asks in her review . Strange, unexpected colors are quickly replacing neutrals on the catwalks, but tangerine is still a pretty bold choice—especially for couture. Expand Photo: Courtesy of Armani Privé 
That said, you can guarantee an orange gown would stand out on the red carpet; as Mower points out, Oscar nominees Nicole Kidman and Isabelle Huppert were both in Armani’s front row. If they were mentally bookmarking dresses for the big night, chances are Look 32 was high on their lists. With jet-black beaded fringe and a curved, crystal-encrusted jacquard bodice, it was a sparkly, fete-worthy twist on the classic column. Here, Armani shares exclusive close-up photos of the dress, which took five seamstresses more than 300 hours to complete.
